When I first got started I was spending a lot of money on my childs weekly meals. Im literally talking hundreds a month! It was ridiculous and very frustrating. Then I figured out how to make this more cost effective and one way was to also use my daughters therapeutic nutrition formula to make the meal batches. So this is what my recipe looks like: 1-2 cans of formula - whatever you have 1 Boneless skinless chicken thigh - cooked 5 oz of green beans, sweet peas, kale, etc 5 oz of apples, pears, peaches, etc 1 tsp of salt 1 tsp of sugar 30mls of olive oil 1/3 cup of cooked rice 8 oz of water or orange juice I blend all of this together and strain. Sometimes I will have to add extra water or juice because the formula is not as thin as I would like. You can use canned goods for your fruits and veggies. I also use fresh ingredients too when they are on sale or I
find a good price. Instead of spending 100s, I might spend about 50-70 a month on her food. I also use turkey meat and a variety of other fruits and veggies. Chicken thighs and legs blend the best, chicken breast not at all for me. The possibility is endless here. You can do this too - just use my recipe as a guide to create your own. Adjust the serving size portion based on the persons nutritional needs. My daughters dietitian helped me come up with this and I just tweak it as I go. My daughter is still getting the benefits from having real food in her diet and I have seen a positive change since I switch from giving her nothing but formula to a mix of the two. -Molly P, Kentucky
